projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
A way to determine specific iOS versions, which can download the app.

Customer needs a feature in titanium, where he can restrict his app, to specific iOS versions.
fields.summary: iOS: Determine iOS versions , which can download the iOS app

comments.body:
The only thing you can do to somewhat limit which iOS version is to set the {{<min-ios-ver>}} setting in the {{<ios>}} section of the {{tiapp.xml}}. There's no way to limit the maximum iOS version.

You can set {{UIRequiredDeviceCapabilities}} in the {{Info.plist}} to require features that can limit the devices you app runs on by requiring features such as "bluetooth-le". This won't guarantee a certain iOS version and it's up to the developer to figure out the possibilities.
Closing ticket as the issue won't fix.
